workflow_instructions.mode_overview: This mode guides the user through the full git commit workflow: staging files, reviewing changes, writing and validating commit messages, running git commit, and enforcing commit standards.

step.details: Parse the user's input to identify: - Which files to stage - The purpose of the commit - Any special requirements (e.g., sign-off, ticket reference)

phase.name: staging
phase.description: Stage the appropriate files for commit

steps.step: Run git add for selected files
Confirm staged changes with git status

phase.name: commit_message
phase.description: Write and validate the commit message

steps.step: Draft a clear, standards-compliant commit message
Execute git commit with the validated message
Handle any pre-commit hooks or errors

phase.name: post_commit
phase.description: Verify commit and provide next steps

completion_criteria.criterion: All intended files are staged and committed
User is informed of next steps
